body.p: Your petitioner Thomas Dunn would represent that he was fined at the late term of the Pendleton Circuit Court April the 1862 the sum of $25 for standing a stud horse without license. He states that he had forgotten when the term of the Court commenced and did not attend. If he had attended no fine would have been imposed upon him. He was the owner of a stud horse "Bill" and farmed him to one John S Merrill who paid the sum of $5 and took out license to stand said horse. He stood the horse at different points a part of the time at the house of Petitioner Hence he was indicted as he supposes. After the season was out petitioner traded the horse off. He herewith files as a part of this petition the licence to stand said horse. He prays your Excellency to remit said fine.
Sworn to before me this 9th day of May 1862.

There is no doubt whatever of the truth of the statements of the petition. The petitioner will have to pay the costs including Comths attos fee all amounting to at least $15 This is hard enough upon him having done no wrong. Please remit
this fine. it ought to be done. I know the Petitioner well as an honest law abiding citizen.
P. S. Please send him the remittance by mail

Pendleton Cir Ct
$25 } Mis
Thos. Dunn
Iss May 13. 1862
